alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Lincoln (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Lincoln and northeastern Franklin Counties through 100 PM CDT... At 1159 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mccall Creek, or 13 miles northeast of Meadville, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... West Lincoln and Center Point around 1220 PM CDT. Bogue Chitto around 1235 PM CDT. Ruth around 1250 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Mississippi.
